trans-unit.source: Indexer operations
trans-unit.target: Indexer operations

trans-unit.source: Indexer operations (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Indexer operations (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: Azure Search can integrate directly with some common data sources, removing the need to write code to index your data.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search can integrate directly with some common data sources, removing the need to write code to index your data.

trans-unit.source: To set up this up, you can call the Azure Search API to create and manage <languageKeyword>indexers</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>data sources</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To set up this up, you can call the Azure Search API to create and manage <languageKeyword>indexers</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>data sources</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: An <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> is a resource that connects data sources with target search indexes.
trans-unit.target: An <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> is a resource that connects data sources with target search indexes.

trans-unit.source: An indexer is used in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: An indexer is used in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Perform a one-time copy of the data to populate an index.
trans-unit.target: Perform a one-time copy of the data to populate an index.

trans-unit.source: Sync an index with changes from the data source on a schedule.
trans-unit.target: Sync an index with changes from the data source on a schedule.

trans-unit.source: The schedule is part of the indexer definition.
trans-unit.target: The schedule is part of the indexer definition.

trans-unit.source: Invoke on-demand to update an index as needed.
trans-unit.target: Invoke on-demand to update an index as needed.

trans-unit.source: All of the above scenarios are achieved through the <link xlink:href="6861f630-43d2-41dd-aa17-db881bffac20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Run Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>, which you can run as a standalone operation or scheduled using the built-in scheduler.
trans-unit.target: All of the above scenarios are achieved through the <link xlink:href="6861f630-43d2-41dd-aa17-db881bffac20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Run Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>, which you can run as a standalone operation or scheduled using the built-in scheduler.

trans-unit.source: An <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> is useful when you want regular updates to an index.
trans-unit.target: An <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> is useful when you want regular updates to an index.

trans-unit.source: You can either set up an inline schedule as part of an indexer definition, or run it on demand using <link xlink:href="6861f630-43d2-41dd-aa17-db881bffac20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Run Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can either set up an inline schedule as part of an indexer definition, or run it on demand using <link xlink:href="6861f630-43d2-41dd-aa17-db881bffac20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Run Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: A <languageKeyword>data source</languageKeyword> specifies what data needs to be indexed, credentials to access the data, and policies to enable Azure Search to efficiently identify changes in the data (such as modified or deleted rows in a database table).
trans-unit.target: A <languageKeyword>data source</languageKeyword> specifies what data needs to be indexed, credentials to access the data, and policies to enable Azure Search to efficiently identify changes in the data (such as modified or deleted rows in a database table).

trans-unit.source: It's defined as an independent resource so that it can be used by multiple indexers.
trans-unit.target: It's defined as an independent resource so that it can be used by multiple indexers.

trans-unit.source: The following data sources are currently supported:
trans-unit.target: The following data sources are currently supported:

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: We're considering adding support for additional data sources in the future.
trans-unit.target: We're considering adding support for additional data sources in the future.

trans-unit.source: To help us prioritize these decisions, please provide your feedback on the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Search feedback forum</linkText><linkUri>http://feedback.azure.com/forums/263029-azure-search</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To help us prioritize these decisions, please provide your feedback on the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Search feedback forum</linkText><linkUri>http://feedback.azure.com/forums/263029-azure-search</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search)</link> for maximum limits related to <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>data source</languageKeyword> resources.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search)</link> for maximum limits related to <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>data source</languageKeyword> resources.

trans-unit.source: Typical workflow
trans-unit.target: Typical workflow

trans-unit.source: You can create and manage <languageKeyword>indexers</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>data sources</languageKeyword> via simple HTTP requests (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE) against a given data source or indexer resource.
trans-unit.target: You can create and manage <languageKeyword>indexers</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>data sources</languageKeyword> via simple HTTP requests (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE) against a given data source or indexer resource.

trans-unit.source: Setting up automatic indexing is typically a four step process:
trans-unit.target: Setting up automatic indexing is typically a four step process:

trans-unit.source: Identify the data source that contains the data that needs to be indexed.
trans-unit.target: Identify the data source that contains the data that needs to be indexed.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that Azure Search may not support all of the data types present in your data source.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that Azure Search may not support all of the data types present in your data source.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="cc08c9f9-2aff-420f-b01a-bbde2e051c08" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported data types (Azure Search)</link> for the list.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="cc08c9f9-2aff-420f-b01a-bbde2e051c08" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported data types (Azure Search)</link> for the list.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search index whose schema is compatible with your data source.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search index whose schema is compatible with your data source.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search <languageKeyword>data source</languageKeyword> as described in <link xlink:href="1c9399cf-e3f6-466f-8a00-73ea27ca18f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search <languageKeyword>data source</languageKeyword> as described in <link xlink:href="1c9399cf-e3f6-466f-8a00-73ea27ca18f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> as described in <link xlink:href="f9224fad-842f-46a4-86da-87b6a6736725" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search <languageKeyword>indexer</languageKeyword> as described in <link xlink:href="f9224fad-842f-46a4-86da-87b6a6736725" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: You should plan on creating one indexer for every target index and data source combination.
trans-unit.target: You should plan on creating one indexer for every target index and data source combination.

trans-unit.source: You can have multiple indexers writing into the same index, and you can reuse the same data source for multiple indexers.
trans-unit.target: You can have multiple indexers writing into the same index, and you can reuse the same data source for multiple indexers.

trans-unit.source: However, an indexer can only consume one data source at a time, and can only write to a single index.
trans-unit.target: However, an indexer can only consume one data source at a time, and can only write to a single index.

trans-unit.source: As the following graphic illustrates, one data source provides input to one indexer, which then populates a single index:
trans-unit.target: As the following graphic illustrates, one data source provides input to one indexer, which then populates a single index:

trans-unit.source: Although you can only use one at a time, resources can be used in different combinations.
trans-unit.target: Although you can only use one at a time, resources can be used in different combinations.

trans-unit.source: The main takeaway of the next illustration is to notice is that a data source can be paired with more than one indexer, and multiple indexers can write to same index.
trans-unit.target: The main takeaway of the next illustration is to notice is that a data source can be paired with more than one indexer, and multiple indexers can write to same index.

trans-unit.source: After creating an indexer, you can retrieve its execution status using the <link xlink:href="630813ce-f125-47dc-967a-6d434b37b2ea" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Indexer Status (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: After creating an indexer, you can retrieve its execution status using the <link xlink:href="630813ce-f125-47dc-967a-6d434b37b2ea" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Indexer Status (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: You can also run an indexer at any time (instead of or in addition to running it periodically on a schedule) using the <link xlink:href="6861f630-43d2-41dd-aa17-db881bffac20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Run Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: You can also run an indexer at any time (instead of or in addition to running it periodically on a schedule) using the <link xlink:href="6861f630-43d2-41dd-aa17-db881bffac20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Run Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> operation.
